result.execSummary:
The defendant John L. Lomax was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Child Pornography, a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.12(1m).
  • Possession of Child Pornography, a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.12(1m).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant John L. Lomax in court with attorney Joseph L Viney.  Defendant John L. Lomax in custody.  Rick C Spoentgen and Michael Albrecht appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court reviewed PSI.  Atty Viney advises he has reviewed PSI and notes corrections.  Court approves state's motion to seal victim impact statements.  Scott M. makes statement.  Beverly K. makes statement.  State makes argument and gives sentence recommendation.  Atty Viney makes argument and gives sentence recommendation.  Court imposes sentence.

Counts 4,5,6,7,8,26,30 & 35 WI State Prison for 6 years (3 years Initial Confinement/3 years Extended Supervision), concurrent to each other but consecutive to any other previously imposed sentence - 232 days pre-sentence credit
Counts 1,2,3,10,11,13,14,24,25,34,36 & 40 WI State Prison for 8 years (5 years Initial Confiement/3 years Extended Supervisions, concurrent to each other but consecutive to to previous counts
Counts 9,12,15,16,17,18,19,20,21,22,23,27,28,29,31,32,33,37,38 & 39 WI State Prison for 15 years (10 years Initial Confinement/5 years Extended Supervision, concurrent to each other but consecutive to all previous counts
Submit to DNA Sample
$500.00 Surcharge x 40
$518.00 Costs x 40 & Supervision Fees
No contact with anyone under the age of 18
Comply with assessment, treatment and programming per agent
Sign release of information forms, per agent
No unsupervised access or use of any device that allows him to view digital images
Sex offender registry but not life time registration
Not -Eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program 
Not -Eligible for Substance Abuse Program

Paperwork handed in court.
Sealing VIS
to Seal VIS
for Payment of Fees for Witness, Berger
for Payment and Affdavit
All 40 verdict forms that read "guilty"...signed
All 40 verdict forms that read "not guilty"...not signed
from Court to jury as to oral question asked from jury room re: exhibits
Jury Question #1
for Custody and Preservation of Exhibits (1-40, 41, 42, 43, 50, 51, 52) - to DCI

(Day three)  State appears by Atty Michael Albrecht and Atty Rick Spoentgen and DOJ Mary Van Schoyck.  DE John Lomax appears in person w/Atty Joseph Viney.  Court states case and parties state appearances.  Parties in agreement w/instructions as the Court intends to read them.  Atty Viney notes if DE testifies that he has one prior conviction.  Parties are in agreement.  State has just to finish direct of Agent Van Schoyck today and then they are done.  Then the defense can begin their case.  Recess at 8:40 until 8:45.  Back on the record w/the jury at 8:50 a.m.  Atty Albrecht recalls Mary Van Schoyck - DOJ - for continued direct exam - S&T.   Atty Viney does cross-exam.  State does re-direct.  Atty Viney does re-cross.  Witness excused.  State rests.  Break at 9:22 a.m. for Court to discuss matters w/parties.  Court addresses sidebar conferences held yesterday afternoon.  Court notes one witness that remained in the courtroom yesterday and parties agreed that he could remain.  Second sidebar was re: the Court seeing exhibit #49.  State notes correction to Ct 36 on exhibit #49 made by witness on the record yesterday.  Parties agree w/exhibit as it is.  Court takes break to allow Atty Viney to confer w/his client re: whether he's going to testify or not.   Recess at 9:27 a.m. for 15 minutes.  Back on the record at 9:50 a.m.  Court questions DE re: his right to testify.  DE wishes to testify.  Atty Viney is in agreement.  Court finds DE knowingly makes determination to testify.  Atty Viney requests the State's witness present in the back not be allowed to be in court for DE's testimony.  State objects.  Court notes sequestration order is in place and witness must remain outside the courtroom while DE testifies.  Jury back in at 9:54 a.m.  Atty Viney calls DE John Lomax - S&T on his own behalf.  Exhibit #53 marked and ID'd.  Court receives #53.  Exhibit #54 marked and ID'd.  Court receives #54.  Jury out at 10:45 a.m.  Court notes what happened in sidebar re: breaking for jury to order lunch and take morning break.  Recess at 10:46 a.m.  Back on the record w/the jury at 11:11 a.m.  Atty Viney continues direct of DE.  Atty Albrecht does cross-exam of DE.  Atty Viney does re-direct.  Witness excused.  Jury out for lunch at 12:08 pm.  Atty Viney states he has no further witnesses.  State is not going to present any rebuttal testimony.  Court will hand out jury instructions as he has them and suggests parties reconvene at 12:50 pm to go over the jury instructions.  Recess at 12:10 pm.  Back on the record at 1:18 pm.  Court addresses modifications to draft instructions discussed off the record.  Two modifications to be made.  As to #2146A - Court will exclude this instruction/portion of it.  As to #180 - Court will exclude this instruction or a portion of it also.  Recess before closing arguments at 1:30 pm.  Back on the record at 2:05 pm.  Court goes over corrections/additions in jury instructions.  Jury in at 2:06 pm.  Court reads instructions to jury.  Atty Albrecht does closing argument.  Break at 3:16 pm.  Back on the record w/the jury at 3:42 pm.  Atty Viney does closing argument.  Atty Albrecht does rebuttal closing.  Court finishes reading instructions.  Clerk strikes #5.  Bailiff sworn and final 12 jurors out at 4:44 pm.  Court notes that three copies of instructions/verdicts were provided to the bailiff to be given to the jury.  No errors in the reading of the instructions to be noted.  Court addresses voicemail left by juror who was cited w/contempt on the first day of the trial.  Bailiff notes jury is wondering re: if they need to request evidence or if it will just be provided.  Parties agree that it would need to be requested.  Court will provide them a written response.  Recess at 4:50 pm.  Back on the record at 4:54 pm.  Court relates written answer from Court to jury re: receiving evidence.  Parties agree.  Back in recess at 4:55 pm.  Back on the record at 5:01 pm.  DE also agrees w/the answer the jury's question.  Back in recess at 5:01 pm after bailiff is provided a copy of the answer.  Back on the record at 5:02 pm.  Court notes jury has provided a note requesting exhibit #49.  State doesn't object but Atty Viney does.  Court feels they need it and #49 goes back to the jury.  Recess again at 5:03 pm.  Back on the record at 6:23 pm.  Parties state appearances (same as before).  Court notes bailiff has informed him the jury has reached a verdict.  Parties are ready to receive the verdict.  Atty Viney addresses proposed order re: order for DCI to retain certain exhibits and they are in agreement.  Court signs the order.  State notes they would prefer the Court poll the jurors after the verdict is received.  Jury in at 6:26 pm.  Foreperson provides verdict forms to the Court.  Court reviews verdict forms and reads verdicts - Jury finds DE Guilty on all 40 counts.  Court polls the jury.  All jurors agree w/the verdicts as read.  Court has sidebar w/attorneys.  Court asks jurors individually re: possible impact of wording on verdict forms that were not used.  Jurors all agree the wording on the not signed verdict forms had no affect on their agreed verdicts.  Court finds verdicts read are the true verdicts of the jury and accepts those verdicts.  Court thanks jurors for their service and they are excused at 6:52 pm.  Court notes reason for sidebar was due to a typo on the verdict form for #23.  Parties are in agreement.  Court directs judgment of conviction be entered on all 40 counts.  State suggests a PSI prior to sentencing and requests bond be revoked.  Atty Viney doesn't object to a PSI but requests the Court not revoke the bond.  Court notes mandatory minimum on each count and doesn't believe continued release would be feasible and orders the bond revoked and DE be taken into custody and be held pending sentencing.  Court goes off the record to set sentencing.  Court sets sentencing date and orders PSI be completed/filed not later than 2/2/2018.

(Day two)  State appears by Atty Rick Spoentgen and Atty Michael Albrecht.  DE John L Lomax appears in person and w/Attorney Joe Viney.  Court states case and parties state appearances.  Parties have nothing to tend to before the jury comes in.  Recess.  Back on the record at 8:47 a.m. w/the jury.  Atty Albrecht calls Jeff Berkley - DOJ - S&T.  Witness ID's DE.  Record to reflect ID.  Exhibit #41 marked and ID'd.  Exhibit #41 is received.  Exhibit #42 marked and ID'd.  Exhibit #42 is received.   Atty Viney does cross-exam.  Atty Albrecht does re-direct.  Atty Viney does re-cross.  Witness excused.  Atty Spoentgen calls Florian Berger - DOJ - S&T.  Witness ID's DE.  Record to reflect ID.  Recess for morning break at 10:10 a.m.  Back on the record w/the jury at 10:35 a.m.  Atty Spoentgen continues direct of witness Berger.  Exhibit #43 marked and ID'd.  Jury excused after sidebar at 11:01 a.m.  Court notes issue w/exhibit #43.  Atty Viney responds, objects to #43 being used for more than refreshing the recollection of the witness.  Atty Spoentgen responds.  Parties agree to have envelope for #43 marked as an exhibit itself.  Atty Viney notes objection to #43 while the jury is out.  State responds re: Exhibit #1 attached to criminal complaint.  Court will allow #43 to be used after discussion and notes Atty Viney is still able to object when jury is in if he so wishes.  Back on the record w/the jury at 11:20 a.m.  Atty Spoentgen continues direct of witness.  Exhibit #50 is marked and ID'd.  Court receives #50.  Exhibit #43 marked and ID'd.  State requests #43 be rec'd.  Atty Viney requests he be allowed to do cross-exam of witness prior to the Court accepting #43.  Court will allow.  Atty Viney does cross-exam of witness re: #43.  Court receives #43.  State continues direct of witness.  Exhibit #44 marked and ID'd.  Court receives #44.  State continues direct.  Exhibit #45 marked and ID'd.  State moves #45.  Atty Viney objects.  Court overrules and receives #45.  State continues direct.  Jury out for lunch at noon until 1:00 pm.  State thinks he'll be done w/witness by 2:30 pm and feels they're still on pace to possibly finish today.  Recess at 12:01 pm.  Back on the record at 1:10 pm.  Atty Albrecht notes parties talked outside the courtroom as to where the State's evidence is going at this time.  CD w/40 exhibits on it is being marked and will be offered.  Power Point/USB driv showing the 40 referenced exhibits (1-40) is also marked.  Atty Viney has nothing to add.  Jury in at 1:13 pm.  Atty Spoentgen continues direct of Mr. Berger.  Exhibit #46 is marked and ID'd.  Court receives #46.  State continues direct.  Exhibit #47 marked and ID'd.  Atty Viney does brief voir dire re: exhibit #47.  Atty Viney objects for the same reason as #43.  Court notes objection and receives #47.  State continues direct.  Exhibit #48 is marked and ID'd.  Court receives #48.  State continues direct.  Exhibit #49 marked and ID'd.  State moves for exhibit #49 to be rec'd.  Court receives #49 w/agreement re: what is to be shown.  State shows portion of #49 to witness for him to ID.  Exhibit #51 is marked and ID'd.  Court receives #51.  State continues direct.  Exhibit #52 marked and ID'd.  Court receives #52.  State continues direct.  Atty Viney does cross-exam.  Jury out at 2:32 pm/recess.  Back on the record at 2:56 pm.  Atty Viney notes exhibits 1-40 were discussed off the record and parties have agreed that all exhibits will be offered and received collectively as opposed to individually.  Atty Albrecht states #52 will also be offered at that time.  Jury back in at 2:58 pm.  Atty Viney continues cross-exam of witness Berger.  Atty Spoentgen does re-direct.  Witness excused.  Atty Albrecht calls Mary Van Schoyck - DOJ - S&T.  Sidebar.  State continues direct.  Exhibits 1-40 marked and ID'd.  Court receives exhibits 1-40.  State continues direct.  State has witness show picture(s) from exhibits 1-40.  Short break.  Witness continues ID'ing photos in 1-40.  State finishes showing images at 5:03 pm.  Jury excused for the day at 5:05 pm.  Court asks for clarification re: who is holding onto exhibits over night.  State notes DCI will hold onto it.  Court asks how long parties feel testimony will last.  Atty Viney feels it may be done by lunch.  Atty Viney not anticipating using any images but parties agree to leave equipment in the room until agent Van Schoyck is done testifying.  Nothing else for tonight before we break.  Recess at 5:08 pm.
on Summary Contempt

(Day one)  Defendant John L. Lomax in court with attorney Joseph L Viney.  Michael X. Albrecht and Rick Spoentgen appeared for the State of Wisconsin along w/Sp. Agent Mary Van Schoyck from DOJ.  Court states case and parties state appearances.  Atty Viney is prepared for trial, as is his client.  Atty Albrecht addresses hat DE has placed on table facing the jury/requests it be put away.  Atty Viney objects.  Court orders hat be placed out of sight of the jury.  State is prepared to proceed.  Court notes matter is set for 3 days and his intention is to allow notetaking.  State doesn't object.  Atty Viney objects to notetaking.  State responds/suggests jury be allowed to ask questions rather than notetaking.  Court will not allow notetaking at this point after discussion.  Court addresses questions from the jurors.  Atty Viney has no opinion one way or the other.  Court will not allow questions from the jury.  There will be one alternate on the jury and each party will get 5 strikes.  Court notes witnesses on his list.  Court goes over some specifics of his planned voir dire questions.  Court goes over how the State is intending to present the evidence.  Atty Viney responds.  Parties discuss size of exhibits.  Atty Viney addresses prior criminal history of DE if he testifies.  State will double check their file.  Court addresses the fact that the DE was in the hallway greeting people this morning and some of them would likely have been jurors.  Off the record the parties discuss anything the DE may have said to parties in the hall to or in front of the potential jurors.  Atty Albrecht addresses this issue.  Atty Viney responds and suggests individual voir of any jurors that may have had any interaction w/DE.  Court directs Atty Viney to confer w/his client.  Court advises DE that his attorney speaks for him and he is not to address the jury in any way.  Court instructs every one that there is to be no interraction w/the jurors.  Jury in at 9:12 a.m.  Court reads opening statement to the jurors.  Clerk calls first 23 jurors.  Court does voir dire.  Court introduces parties to the jury.  #15 excused and #24 called.  #16 is excused and #25 is called.  #7 is excused and #26 is called.  Court does individual voir dire in chambers w/#10 and then #27 as she is called off the record.  Court excuses #10 and #27 takes her place in the jury box.  Court questions #27 further.  #27 is excused and #28 called.  Court continues voir dire.  #22 excused and #29 is called.  Atty Spoentgen does voir dire.  #20 and #21 are excused and #30 and #31 are called.  #30 excused and #32 called.  #31 excused and #33 called.  Court goes off the record for a chat w/counsel in chambers.  Back on the record at 10:18 a.m.  Court asks questions of #33.  #33 is excused and #34 is called.  State continues voir dire.  Atty Viney does voir dire.  Court asks questions of #9 re: her knowing Atty Viney.  Atty Spoentgen asks questions of #9 and asks she be excused.  Atty Viney responds.  Court will not excuse #9.  Parties do strikes.  Court has bailiff take all 23 jurors back to the jury room.  Court security takes the remaining unpicked jurors to Br 3 jury room.  On the record at 11:06 a.m.  Court notes interruption from a juror in the back of the room while parties were doing strikes.  Atty Viney responds as to what he heard the juror say and feels it taints the panel.  Atty Albrecht has nothing to add but feels they can proceed today but would like some time to do some research.  Court would like to bring everyone back and do further voir dire re: any impact this may have had and then make a decision.  Jury back in at 11:14 a.m.  Court notes peremptory strikes were made and notes comment made by another juror that was still seated in the back of the courtroom.  All jurors agree they did hear what was said and Court asks jurors questions re: that statement.  Atty Viney asks questions of jury.  No questions from the State.  Clerk calls final 13 jurors.  Court excuses the jurors names not called into the back of the courtroom.  Court introduces bailiff to the jury.  Court thanks jurors that were not chosen and they are excused at 11:24 a.m.  Court has juror who spoke out (#36) come into the courtroom and testify from the witness stand re: what he said in court earlier.  Court admonishes #36 re: what he said.  Court finds him in contempt and orders he sit in jail until 7:30 a.m. tomorrow.  Court security takes #36 into custody.  Court notes in chambers sidebar re: possibly running out of jurors during voir dire and states result of that sidebar.  Court orders sequestration of witnesses during trial.  Recess at 11:33 a.m. until 12:45 pm.  Back on the record at 11:37 a.m.  Juror #1192 will be allowed to leave and return per agreement of parties and court instruction.  Back on the record w/o jury at 12:50 pm.  Atty Viney makes motion for this panel to be dismissed due to issue which happened prior to lunch break.  Atty Spoentgen notes State vs. Hackl 14AP1765-CR.  Atty Viney responds/he had reviewed that case.  Court is satisfield w/how the issue has been handled and they will proceed as is.  Court notes new instruction provided to parties re: notetaking.  State notes discrepancy re: instruction as the Court intends to read to the jury.  Atty Viney responds re: notetaking.  Court considers and decides that notetaking will not be allowed.  Jury in at 1:10 pm.  Clerk swears in final 13 jurors.  Court reads instructions to the jury.  Atty Spoentgen makes opening statement for the State.  Atty Viney does opening statement.  Atty Albrecht calls Det. Michael Carpenter from City of Waukesha PD - S&T.  Atty Viney does cross-exam.  Jury out for break at 2:33 pm.  Court notes DE's hat is back where it he was told it was not to be.  Court advises Atty Viney to have his client remove the hat from the courtroom and it is not to return to the courtroom at any time during the jury trial.  State makes statement and requests the right to make argument after break.  Recess as 2:35 pm.  Back on the record at 2:55 pm.  Atty Albrecht states at this point he feels any addressing the hat issue would just draw more attention to it.  Court will take testimony until 4 today and then would like to address conduct and/or attire for tomorrow.  Jury back in at 2:57 pm.  Atty Viney continues cross-exam of witness.  Atty Albrecht does re-direct.  Atty Viney does re-cross.  Court questions witness briefly.  Witness excused.  Atty Spoentgen calls Jennifer Price - DOJ - S&T.  Witness ID's DE.  Record to reflect ID.  Atty Spoentgen continues direct of witness.  Atty Viney does cross-exam.  Court sends jury to jury room at 3:49 pm.  Court addresses DE re: his possible testimony later and admonishes him re: motions he's making that the jury can see.  Back on the record w/the jury at 3:51 pm.  Atty Viney continues cross-exam.  Atty Spoentgen does re-direct.  Witness excused.  Court excuses jury and advises them to be back before 8:45 tomorrow as he wishes to go on the record at 8:45 tomorrow morning.  Court advises jurors of some of the previous instructions already read to them.  Jury out at 4:11 pm.  Atty Albrecht addresses DCI maintaining exhibits relating to the child pornography.  Court responds/custody should remain w/DCI.  State would need to maintain those exhibits in case of an appeal.  Atty Viney responds/doesn't object.  Court checked w/one juror re: special needs and notes schedule he is planning to meet her needs.  Parties to be ready to proceed at 8:30 tomorrow morning.  Court questions Atty Viney and DE re: his presentation for the remainder of the trial.  Atty Viney to escort the DE in tomorrow morning.  Recess for the day at 4:19 pm.

Court states case.  Albrecht and Viney state appearances.  Michael Albrecht appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Joseph Viney appeared with John L. Lomax, John Lomax appeared in custody.  Viney addresses Court; provides history/status, addresses expert witnesses, addresses bond as modified and bond money transfered to this case from another matter, requests that the remaining bond be posted by a credit card.  Court responds; remaining bond to be paid by a credit card.  Albrecht addresses Court; addresses witnesses to be called, expert witness addressed, State is ready to proceed.  Court addresses expert witness report received.  Albrecht responds; addresses the report as received, issue as to evidence addressed.  Court responds.  Viney responds; addresses the evidence, expert witness information addressed, addresses the expert's report.  Court responds; noon today was the deadline for additional information/evidence.  Albrecht responds; objects to the expert testifying, additional information addressed, late response addressed.  Court instructs if an additional hearing is needed, it will need to be heard before noon today, jury trial will proceed on December 4, 2017.

Defendant John L. Lomax in court with attorney Joseph L Viney.  Kevin R. Calkins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court states case and State states appearances.  Court notes no new motions filed that haven't already been addressed.  Parties agree there are no prior convictions.  Atty Viney states they are ready for trial.  State says they will be ready also.  Court goes over sequestration.  Atty Viney requests that.  State doesn't object.  Court will order sequestration.  State unclear who court officer will be as yet.  No victims expected to be present for trial.  State questions if Court is anticipating alternate jurors.  Instructions filed by State and Atty Viney will file his before the end of the day but neither party says they have anything out of the ordinary.  State addresses possible audio/visual presentations.  Parties to let Court know if they will need them to set up any audio/visual aids.  Exhibit lists discussed.  Court addresses notetaking.  Atty Viney takes no position.  State doesn't want notetaking.  Court will not allow notetaking.  No questions to be allowed from the jury and there will be two alternate jurors.  State's witness list is still the same as when he previously filed it.  Court thinks the jurors will view a video prior to entering the courtroom so his initial instructions will be shorter.  Asks parties to be here by 8:30 the day of trial.

Court responds;  cites s. 971.14(2)(a) and s. 971.14(1r)(b) and the process to appoint an evaluator.  Court addresses Viney; Lomax being competent to proceed. Calkins responds; he and Viney will work together to choose and evaluator and will notify the Court of the person chosen by week's end.
